page.title: 01Beeswing Dumfriesshire
page.content: The A711 Dumfries-Dalbeattic road follows a kilometre wide corridor of relatively level lowland used for pasture, sheep & cattle rearing , with some arable land. Beeswing is a little more than a hamlet with a garage specialising in agricultural repairs, a village hall and a church. To the SE hills rise abruptly and grassland gives way to rough moorland, with an area of coniferous plantation in the NE Loch Arthur is a shallow reed-fringed lake surrounded by developing scrub and woodland. There are few roads and the population is extremely small.
